+  describe 'POST create' do
+    context 'with an unauthenticated user' do
+      let(:params) { attributes_for :conference }
+
+      it 'cannot create new conference' do
+        expect {
+          post :create,
+          params: { conference: params }
+        }.not_to change { Conference.count }
+      end
+
+      it 'cannot create new conference' do
+        expect {
+          post :create,
+          params: { conference: params },
+          xhr: true
+        }.not_to change { Conference.count }
+      end
+
+      it 'should return a 401 response status' do
+        post :create, params: { conference: params }, xhr: true
+        expect(response).to have_http_status(401)
+      end
+
+    end

+    context 'with user logged in' do

+

body: You mean it's a bad practice to use :each because I just have one context after it, or it should not be used at all?
